labels.title: 37.1538E, 54.50.41, 54.50.42, 54.50.35
labels.content: The Persian conquest of Egypt in 525 <small>B.C.E.</small> led to a vogue for metalwork in the Persian style, such as these animal-shaped handles and fluted bowls with floral decorations on the base. All of these objects were discovered in Egypt; the silver pieces were discovered together with a large number of objects as an offering at a temple of a foreign goddess.

collections.name: Egyptian, Classical, Ancient Near Eastern Art
